Package com.berthoud.project3oc.gameclasses

Class Game2ModeDefender

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berthoud.project3oc.gameclasses.Games

  • public class Game2ModeDefender
extends Game2
    The program Game2ModeDefender implements the Mastermind in the mode defender: the computer tries to break the player's code

      • poolCombinations

        private byte[][] poolCombinations
        This field is required for the AI part. This byte array stores all the combinations possible based on Games.nbVariations and Games.nbDigits

      • play

        public void play()
        This method is a wrapper-method that starts and executes the game until the end. All the methods required for the execution of the game are called within this wrapper-method. The implementation is different for each game and mode.
        Specified by:
        play in class Games

      • inputValidation

        private void inputValidation​(int myInt)
        This method takes a scanner entry that must be identical with the int value entered as parameter. If the entry is different, the program enters a loop until and exit only when the right value is entered.
        Parameters:
        myInt - the int value that the scanner input must be identical to

      • answerComputer

        private void answerComputer()
        This method is used for the AI part. It generates an appropriate next guess based on the validation of the previous guess. It is inspired by Knuth's algorithm. The algorithm here works as follows:

        1. creation of a pool of all possible combinations, stored as a multidimensional byte array creationPoolCombinations() fillingPoolCombinations(byte[])

        2. Computer makes a 1st guess and receives a validation answer by user inputValidation(int)

        3. the next step is to check which validation this same guess would have return for each combination of the pool.

        4. all these hypothetical validations are compared to the original user validation. If they are different, it means that the hypothetical combination that returned the validation can not be the right combination. It is also put aside from the pool of combination. To identify the combinations put aside the program overides their first digit with the value -1

        5. For the next guess, the program takes the first combination of the pool which do not start with -1

      • creationPoolCombinations

        private void creationPoolCombinations()
        This method is used for the AI part. It creates a set of all possible combinations, stored as an array of byte arrays. The algorithm for filling in the array is based on recursivity: 1. assignment of values for the 1st byte array (= 1st combination) 2. the values of byte array nr. N is based on the values of byte array nr. N-1. A separate method fillingPoolCombinations(byte[])takes byte array nr. N and gives back byte array nr. N+1

      • fillingPoolCombinations

        private byte[] fillingPoolCombinations​(byte[] tab)
        This method is used for the AI part. It is used for creating creationPoolCombinations(), a multidimentional byte array storing all the combinations possible.
        Parameters:
        tab - the method is based on recursivity. It takes one combination stored as a byte array and returns the next combination stored as a byte array.
        Returns:
        the next combination of the pool
